result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharge. Pay all court costs, assessments and fees including the DNA in this action during period of probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

- Possess no weapons. Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Referred to Mental Health Unit of probation.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program.
- AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
- Absolute sobriety - no illegal drugs or alcohol.
- Random urine screens at least once a month.
- No Contact with persons or places using or possessing illegal drugs or weapons.
- No Contact with Frettie P.
- Cooperate fully with Probation Agent.
- Maintain full time employment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at discretion of Probation Agent/until next court date, review on 09-25-15 @ 1:30pm, Br-40.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 2 and all other matters

records.addlTxt: Defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $310.57 payable to Frettie P.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment. Received and filed: resitution worksheet. Case remains calendared for a probation review hearing 9/25/15.
Restitution hearing scheduled for 08-21-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced for today's scheduled restitution hearing.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Victim has not gathered all documentation as to restitution requested.  As defendant was not produced and documentation not completed by victim, Court orders case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 40.
Court finds cause and orders time limits waived.
Clerk:  jms
Restitution hearing should have been on court calendar but was not.  Defendant did not appear.  Matter rescheduled to 8/05/15 at 1:30 pm.

Statements made as to sentencing as to Count Three: 

The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF TWO  YEARS, with credit for ZERO days time served; CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT TWO  AND ALL OTHER MATTERS, the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is ONE YEAR.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of TWO YEARS  with the following conditions:

-Defendant to serve 30 DAYS   in the House of Correction, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent/until next court date review on 9-25-15 at 1:30 in branch 40.
-referred to mental health unit of probation
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens at least once a month.
-No Contact with Frettie P.
-Possess no weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Attend and successfully  complete Batterers Intervention Program
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees, domestic abuse surcharge in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Review hearing scheduled for 09-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded as to Count TWO:  

The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF TWO YEARS, with credit for 30 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is ONE YEAR.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of TWO YEARS  with the following conditions:

-Defendant to serve 30 DAYS   in the House of Correction, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent/until next court date.
-referred to mental health unit of probation
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens at least once a month.
-No Contact with persons or places using or possessing illegal drugs or weapons.
-Possess no weapons
-Maintain full time employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This case is being heard for branch 40. 

On motion of the state, court ordered count TWO penalty enhancer "use of a dangerous weapon" : Dismissed.  

AS TO COUNTS TWO AND THREE:  

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING.
from the defendant received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: FRETTIE P.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Calvert Darnell Rucker in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
